title: David Wallace-Wells on Empowering the Future
description:
Ryan talks to journalist David Wallace-Wells about his new book The Uninhabitable Earth: Life After Warming, seeking out information, challenging assumptions, and becoming empowered through better understanding.

During his 11 years at New York magazine, David has emerged as one of the nationâ€™s most formidable thinkers about science and society, writing agenda-setting essays on the dangers and complexities of global warming. His 2019 book, â€œThe Uninhabitable Earth: Life After Warming,â€ was a number one Times bestseller, and reviewers called it both â€œbrilliantâ€ and â€œthe most terrifying book I have ever readâ€; The Washington Post aptly called it â€œthe â€˜Silent Springâ€™ of our time,â€ and it has become a touchstone for the younger generation of climate activists who have helped redraw the landscape of global climate politics in just the last few years.
